message: The Lebanese Ministry of Health: 11 injured in the IDF attack last night in the Beqaa area.

°Action against a hostile Twitter account associated with Hezbollah

Here is a tweet from the Twitter account of Ali Shoaib, Hezbollah's correspondent for the Lebanese Almanar channel, in which he praises the suicide bomber who blew himself up on Sunday in Tel Aviv.

Please report him under the terrorism classification:👇

https://x.com/alishoieb1/status/1825467866763743574?s=19
A video released tonight by Hezbollah in which a suicide drone is seen approaching a post of antennas and security systems at one of the IDF posts on the border with an explosive.
Gazan prisoners that Israel released this morning to the Gaza Strip.

The Palestinians report that this morning Israel released about 40 Gazan prisoners to the Gaza Strip, through the Kerem Shalom crossing.
They arrived at the European Hospital in Khan Yunis.

The six were kidnapped alive and murdered in Hamas captivity.
As part of the deal, their bodies were to return only in the third phase, after a permanent ceasefire, after the start of the reconstruction of the Strip - probably in many months at the very least.

Joint IDF and ISA announcement: 

The IDF and ISA rescued the bodies of the hostages Yagev Buchshtab, Alexander Dancyg, Avraham Munder, Yoram Metzger, Nadav Popplewell, and Haim Perry from the Khan Yunis area in the Gaza Strip

Overnight (Monday), in a joint IDF and ISA operation, the bodies of the hostages Yagev Buchshtab, Alexander Dancyg, Avraham Munder, Yoram Metzger, Nadav Popplewell, and Haim Perry were rescued from the Khan Yunis area in the Gaza Strip. 

The rescue operation was conducted under the command of the 98th Division and carried out by the Paratroopers Brigade, 'Yahalom' Unit, and the 75th Battalion, along with ISA forces.

The operation was enabled by precise intelligence from the ISA, IDF intelligence units, and the IDF Intelligence Directorate Hostage Headquarters.

Chicago: Anti-Israeli protesters breach the security fence near the convention of the Democratic Party in the USA calling for an end to the war in Gaza. They are trying to put pressure on the Democrats to stop supplying Israel with weapons.

IDF Spokesperson reported this morning: Following the sirens that sounded a short while ago in the areas of the Upper Galilee and the Golan Heights, approximately 55 projectiles were identified crossing from Lebanese territory. Some of the projectiles were intercepted, and the rest fell in open areas. No injuries were reported. 

Israel Fire and Rescue Services are currently operating to extinguish fires that broke out in several areas in northern Israel due to falling projectiles.

Shortly after the launches, the IAF struck one of the launchers from which the projectiles were fired.

Rocket barrages from Lebanon:
Hezbollah publishes an announcement in which it accepts responsibility for launching rockets this morning at the "Jordan Facility" and "Nafah Facility" in the Golan - in response to last night's attack in the Beqaa area.
"Turkish love" - ​​a Saudi tourist is beaten by Turks in Istanbul after they accused him of taking pictures of women on his cell phone.

More from Syria: The supermoon - as seen last night from Syria.
This is a phenomenon that occurs once every three years, making the moon appear larger by about 14% and brighter by about 30%.

Some claim that there is a connection between this phenomenon and earthquakes.

Under the direction of Syrian President Assad, from now on all Palestinians are exempt from the need for visas and fees when entering Syria.

Syria encourages Palestinian immigration to it.
Nice on Bashar's part (:
Shazar also came to express his sympathy at Majdal Shams, the soccer field where 12 local residents, most of them children, were killed as a result of a Hezbollah rocket.

And more about mocking Iranian reactions to Israeli attacks, the Syrian exile Shazar came to visit the Temple Mount carrying the flag of the Syrian opposition opposing the rule of Bashar Assad.

A video in which he mocks the Iranian ambassador and Hassan Nasrallah, which was filmed while he was on the Temple Mount, received a lot of attention on social networks (over a million views on Twitter).

The tweeters of the Shia axis are going out of their way...

The deputy commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards is trying to explain the "delay in responding to the assassination of Haniyeh":

"The response to the assassination of Haniyeh is a settled matter. It will occur at the right time and place."

Among Arab social media users, his comments are met with much ridicule: The banner of revenge is showing wear and tear; 20 days have passed, surpassing the timeframe they set when they prepared the banner.

According to Lebanese channels, this footage shows the Israeli attacks that took place last night in the Tyre area.

The hysteria there is evident.

Hezbollah announced a death in its ranks last night:

Hussein Ali Suleiman

He was killed in the IDF attack last night in Deir Qanoun in southern Lebanon. According to the IDF spokesman as mentioned above, he was a key terrorist in the organization's Rocket and Nissile Unit in the Yarine area.

Number 417

IDF: A short while ago, IAF fighter jets struck a number of Hezbollah weapons storage facilities in the area of Beqaa in Lebanon. Following the strikes, secondary explosions were identified, indicating the presence of large amounts of weapons in the facilities struck. 

In addition, an IAF aircraft eliminated the terrorist Hussein Ali Hussein in the area of Deir Qanoun in southern Lebanon. Hussein was a significant terrorist in Hezbollah's Rocket and Missile Unit in the area of Yarine. 

In addition, earlier today, IDF forces identified a terrorist cell operating from a Hezbollah military structure in the area of Tayibe in southern Lebanon. IAF fighter jets struck the structure in which the terrorists were operating.
